faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Everything you need to know about learning with Saqia Madrasa.

questions.question: Is this course only for women?
questions.answer: Yes, all programs at Saqia Madrasa are exclusively for women and are taught by Hayrunnisa Yengilmes.

questions.question: Can children join these classes?
questions.answer: These classes are primarily designed for adult women. However, young girls may join if they are mature enough to follow the lesson alongside adult students. Please note that these classes are strictly for females only; boys are not permitted to enroll regardless of age.

questions.question: In what language will the classes be conducted?
questions.answer: The teacher is multilingual and can provide instructions in Uyghur/Uzbek, Turkish, and English. Even if you do not speak these languages, you can still participate effectively. Since Quranic learning is primarily based on listening and repeating after the teacher, language will not be a significant barrier.

questions.question: What if I live in a different time zone?
questions.answer: All class times are listed in Eastern Standard Time (EST). Please make sure to convert the time to your local time zone before registering to ensure you can attend the live sessions.

questions.question: Is the tuition fee refundable?
questions.answer: Tuition fees are generally non-refundable once the course has started.

questions.question: What if the class I want to join is already full?
questions.answer: Each class is strictly limited to 30 students to ensure quality. If a class is full, you can join our Waiting List to receive priority notification and a chance to pre-register for the next session.

questions.question: Can I join the Advanced Class at any time?
questions.answer: Yes. Since the Advanced Class (30 Juz Khatm) moves through one Juz every 4 weeks, you can join at the start of any new Juz/month, provided there is an available spot.

questions.question: How do I get the Zoom link for the lessons?
questions.answer: After your payment is confirmed, you will automatically receive an email with your dedicated Zoom link.

questions.question: Do I need a new link for every class?
questions.answer: No. The link you receive is a recurring link. You will use the same link for every Monday session throughout your entire 12-week or monthly term.

questions.question: What is the primary platform for the classes?
questions.answer: All lessons are conducted live via Zoom. We recommend having a stable internet connection and a quiet space to get the most out of your Quranic journey.

questions.question: Will I receive recordings if I miss a class?
questions.answer: No, we do not provide class recordings. To gain the full spiritual and educational benefit, we encourage all students to attend the interactive live sessions.

questions.question: Will the same classes be offered again after the 3-month term ends?
questions.answer: Yes. Our 12-week programs (Beginner and Intermediate) are designed to repeat. Once a term concludes, a new 3-month term for the same levels will begin.

questions.question: Can returning students retake the same 3-month course for review?
questions.answer: Yes. Students who have completed a 3-month term and wish to retake the same level for review and further practice are welcome to join. You will simply need to register again and pay the tuition fee for the new term.

questions.question: How can I contact the teacher if I have a question?
questions.answer: If you have any questions or need to speak with the teacher, you can leave a message through the Contact Form on this website or send us an email. We will get back to you as soon as possible.
